mem-001.title: User's favorite programming language
mem-001.content: The user prefers TypeScript over JavaScript for its type safety and better IDE support. They have been using TypeScript for 3 years in production.

mem-002.title: Project architecture discussion
mem-002.content: Discussed the microservices architecture for the new e-commerce platform. Decided to use Node.js with TypeScript for backend services and React for the frontend.

mem-003.title: Task: Implement user authentication
mem-003.content: Need to implement JWT-based authentication system with refresh tokens. Should include email verification and password reset functionality. Target completion: end of sprint.

mem-004.title: User prefers dark mode
mem-004.content: User strongly prefers dark mode interfaces and finds light themes straining on the eyes, especially during long coding sessions.

mem-005.title: TypeScript best practices
mem-005.content: Key TypeScript best practices: Use strict mode, avoid 'any' type, prefer interfaces over type aliases for object shapes, use const assertions, and leverage discriminated unions for type safety.

mem-006.title: Working relationship with frontend team
mem-006.content: User collaborates closely with the frontend team led by Sarah. They have weekly sync meetings every Monday at 10 AM to align on API contracts and integration points.

mem-007.title: Goal: Master system design
mem-007.content: User's goal is to become proficient in system design and architecture patterns within the next 6 months. Plans to study scalability, distributed systems, and database design.

mem-008.title: Assistant coding style
mem-008.content: When providing code examples, I prefer to include detailed comments, follow functional programming patterns where appropriate, and prioritize code readability over cleverness.
